page.title: 10An elderly resident speaks
page.content: Mrs Jenkins was born in 1901.She is 84 years old and has lived on the Graig all her life.There were no taps or toilets inside her house,they were in the garden.She said that gas gave a better light.She went to Graig-y-wion school.If they were late they would have the cane.It was a senior school, boys were upstairs and girls down.She said that school is more enjoyable in 1985 as she was only taught arithmetic penmanship and PE drill.They would skip,play hop-scotch and whip the top. Now,children have more presents and pocket money.She only had a market penny to spend in Pontypridd market. There are not as many shops on the Graig now.Then people were more friendly,you could leave your homes open.Every night a policeman would come around to check that everthing was alright.(Lisa Marshall-Graig)
